content.speaker: The SPEAKER pro tempore
content.text:
The SPEAKER pro tempore. Pursuant to clause 8 of rule XX, the 
unfinished business is the vote on the motion to suspend the rules and 
pass the bill (H.R. 4044) to amend the Federal Water Pollution Control 
Act to reauthorize the National Estuary Program, and for other 
purposes, as amended, on which the yeas and nays were ordered.

content.speaker: The Clerk
content.text: The Clerk read the title of the bill.

content.speaker: The SPEAKER pro tempore
content.text:
The SPEAKER pro tempore. The question is on the motion offered by the 
gentleman from New Jersey (Mr. Malinowski) that the House suspend the 
rules and pass the bill, as amended.
  This is a 5-minute vote.

content.speaker: The RECORDER
content.text:
The vote was taken by electronic device, and there were--yeas 355, 
nays 62, not voting 12, as follows:

                             [Roll No. 35]

  Messrs. MEADOWS, JOYCE of Pennsylvania, KEVIN HERN of Oklahoma, 
COMER, PALMER, and WEBER of Texas changed their vote from ``yea'' to 
``nay.''
  Messrs. GUTHRIE, GAETZ, and WILSON of South Carolina changed their 
vote from ``nay'' to ``yea.''
  So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and 
the bill, as amended, was passed.
  The result of the vote was announced as above recorded.
  A motion to reconsider was laid on the table.

doc_title: PROTECT AND RESTORE AMERICA'S ESTUARIES ACT
title: PROTECT AND RESTORE AMERICA'S ESTUARIES ACT
